thread.title: Portland State finding ground success on and off the field

title: Portland State finding ground success on and off the field
text:

Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Portland State finding ground success on and off the field KGW Staff 10:43 p.m. PDT October 22, 2015 Portland State Vikings stop at In-N-Out on bus trip to southern California for game against Cal Poly. (Photo: Coach AC Patterson) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
PORTLAND, Ore. -- The Portland State Vikings have been one of the most surprising teams in college football this season. 
New head coach Bruce Barnum, who began the season as the interim head coach, has led the No. 14 Vikings to a 5-1 start, and was rewarded with a five-year contract last week . 
Among the many changes Barnum has implemented is travel. When possible, the team travels by bus instead of plane. 
And so far it's worked. The team bused to Pullman, where they beat Washington State 24-17 in the season opener. It was Portland State's first ever win against a Pac-12 opponent. 
The Vikings bused to Pocatello, Idaho, for its matchup against Idaho State. They won 34-14. 
This week, they're busing to southern California as the team takes on Cal Poly Saturday night. 
But the trips aren't just about football. 
Among the stops on this week's road trip was In-N-Out on Thursday and Alcatraz on Friday. 
After the pit stops though, it's all business as the Vikings look to improve to 6-1, making the two-day trek back to Portland much more enjoyable. Portland State Vikings stop at In-N-Out on bus trip to southern California for game against Cal Poly.
